How do I use the `verus` command to send a request to a remote server using HTTP?

You don't use the `verus` command to send an HTTP request to a remote server. Instead, you can use the `curl` command to send a JSON-RPC request to a local Verus node, like this: `curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getcurrency", "params": ["currencyname"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/`

Examples:
> verus getcurrency "currencyname"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getcurrency", "params": ["currencyname"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
